name: Daniel Vasquez
profile: Self-driven software engineer with a passion for creating workflow tools and pipelines for 3D artists and designers in visual effects, animation, and fashion & apparel.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description:
Proactively led the development of web 3D viewing and annotating solutions in the digitalisation of the product life cycle at leading fashion & apparel brands.
Reduced file export times from minutes to seconds by implementing automation plugins in Python/C++.
Key contributor on desktop application to efficiently upload large files and submit jobs for rendering 3D content.
Supported backend engineering team in building a proprietary compute graph framework on AWS for scalable cloud-native rendering and processing of 3D assets.
Extended Python processes in our compute framework and resolved bugs in complex graphs.
Started tenure at a startup which was acquired by LFX Digital.

experience.title: Software Developer (Pipeline TD)
experience.description:
Designed and developed plugins for third-party 3D applications to efficiently export and publish large asset files.
Supported over 30 artists and technical directors across the visual effects pipeline by debugging issues in asset management and workflows.
Extended and maintained internal APIs and cross platform desktop tools for the setup, caching, viewing, and tracking of thousands of digital assets.
Designed and wrote technical briefs.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description:
Designed and implemented a Python API to automate high-throughput processing of images for panoramic stitching, resulting in a co-authored publication at SIGGRAPH 2015.
Collaborated asynchronously with developers in various studios across multiple time zones.
Provided technical support to over 20 internal users.
Oversaw updates on ~80 configurations of Linux environments, coordinated with department supervisors to ensure timely and scheduled releases.

experience.title: Technical Artist
experience.description:
Conceptualized and created visual media for science education, mechanism-of-action renderings, and marketing for clients such as United Nations, GenomeDx, Telus, and Nissan.
Created 3D content and visual effects for animated or live-action films, and mobile apps.
Wrote software tools and scripts to streamline animation process.

experience.title: Software Developer (internship)
experience.description:
Followed UX designs in HTML, CSS and JavaScript for internal web application.
Wrote production quality, client-side code in Eclipse IDE and debugged using Chrome DevTools.
Built Ajax enabled custom widgets using Dojo Toolkit framework.
Learned the requisite web technologies while adhereing to tight deadlines in the Agile process

experience.title: Animation Specialist
experience.description:
Conceptualized and created commercial and educational videos.
Wrote scripts for the screen and developed storyboards.
Build and render 3D animation content.
Directed and lit live action content.
Edited, composited, and compressed videos.
Programmed in MEL and simulated natural materials using nCLoth

experience.title: 3D Animator
experience.description:
Client: Telus.
Created low-polygon model.
Textured and animated photorealistic Telus hippopotamus.
Optimized exports to Collada format for augmented reality application

experience.title: Sciences & Math Instructor
experience.description:
Instructed seven courses in Grades 7, 8, 9, and 12 in the French curriculum.
Taught and guided students in the subjects of math, physics, biology, and chemistry.
Prepared workshops and activities to supplement theory.
Assessed student progress while maintaining accurate records and reports

experience.title: 3D Artist
experience.description:
Client: Nissan.
Textured, lit, and composited photorealistic car.
Modelled and UV-mapped old lady character in a short film (Collaboration: PSST!)

experience.title: Medical Internist Assistant
experience.description:
Effectively assisted patients and supported staff with practical assistance.
Observed and participated in several surgical procedures, and adeptly sutured patients with minimal assistance.
Shadowed physicians and medical students in the emergency and operating room

experience.title: Research Assistant - Stem Cell Signaling
experience.description:
Conducted research on biomolecular pathways regulating cell fate in embryonic stem cells.
Operated specialized instrumentation and computer software for analyzing cells.
Presented background information on stem cell signaling and research results during lab meetings

experience.title: Research Assistant - Polyglutamine Neurodegenerative Diseases
experience.description:
Conducted research on protein dynamics using green fluorescent protein technology.
Used problem solving skills for optimizing experimental results.
Applied fluorescence microscopy to generate 3D images and movies of protein in live cells.
Managed and organized the output of thousands of files

education.details:
Courses completed include Systematic Program Design, Software Engineering, Models of Computation, Hardware and Operating Systems, Algorithms and Data Structures, Relational Databases, and Artificial Intelligence.
Programming in Java, C/C++, and Python

Extensive training in 3D modeling and animation, including rigging, shading, lighting, rendering, and dynamics.
Foundations in acting, life drawing and storyboarding

Theory and practice in a curriculum spanning biology, chemistry, physics, and genetic engineering.
Elective courses in film studies and anthropology

projects.title: Spotyt
projects.details: Containerized web application to play and download Spotify playlists, achieved 10x speed improvement in batch downloads by implementing asynchronous I/O streaming from backend

projects.title: Lyddy
projects.details: Social media network using an undirected graph structure in Firebase Realtime Database, with a React frontend

publications.title: Roundshot Pipeline at MPC for "Godzilla"
publications.details:
For "Godzilla" and many upcoming films at MPC, hundreds of panoramic images were acquired and a proper pipeline was needed to supply departments with quick previews and automated stitching. We were tasked with capturing and recreating many on-set locations. Roundshots are panoramic images captured on set for use in compositing, lighting and environments.
Accurate incorporation and interpretation of the captured images for use in film is essential to maintain the visual and spatial information as well as to better accommodate creative direction. Several new processes were required to update MPC's pipeline to accommodate a large amount of data with a dynamic workflow. With such a broad array of images, a combination of automation and stakeholder visibility were needed to use them effectively.

highlights: Successfully launched a SaaS product as a core contributor at a startup, streamlining 3D content creation workflows and accelerating digital transformation for leading apparel brands such as Supreme and Tommy Hilfiger.  Led the integration of a web frontend for annotating and collaborating on enterprise-scale 3D datasets following the acquisition of the startup by LFX Digital.  Designed and implemented a Python API at MPC, resulting in co-authoring a SIGGRAPH publication.  Actively seeking opportunities to grow with a company that pushes the boundaries in visual storytelling and immersive experiences.
skills: 2D/3D content creation tooling and workflow automation, Full stack web development, Agile practices, UI design, Writing technical and end-user documentation, Mentoring and code reviewing, RESTful APIs
